snippet: Brazil, which has more people of African descent than any other country outside of the continent itself, is raising its profile there again by building on ties from the Portuguese empire.
abstract: Brazil, which has more people of African descent than any other country outside of Africa itself, is assertively raising its profile on the continent through an array of aid projects and loans; charm offensive has helped trade between the Brazil and Africa surge to $27.6 billion in 2011, from just $4.3 billion in 2002.
lead_paragraph: Brazil, which has more people of African descent than any other country outside of the continent itself, is raising its profile there again by building on ties from the Portuguese empire.

headline.seo: Brazil Gains in Reaching Out to Africa
headline.main: Brazil Gains Business and Influence as It Offers Aid and Loans in Africa
headline.print_headline: Brazil Gains Business and Influence as It Offers Aid and Loans in Africa
